thread.title: Hammond: 'Uncomfortable issues will be raised' with China
thread.title_full: Hammond: 'Uncomfortable issues will be raised' with China - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Hammond: 'Uncomfortable issues will be raised' with China
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Hammond: 'Uncomfortable issues will be raised' with China 20 October 2015 Last updated at 08:32 BST
Members of the Royal Family and politicians are due to greet China's President Xi Jinping at the start of his four-day state visit to the UK.
The UK Treasury hopes to make China Britain's second biggest trading partner within 10 years, but critics have voiced concerns about censorship and human rights violations.
Speaking to BBC Breakfast, Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond insisted the government would "certainly take the opportunity to raise issues which will be uncomfortable".
Read more Xi Jinping visit: UK royals and MPs to greet Chinese leader
